data.content:
noun
plural -tisms
a Christian ceremony in which a small amount of water is placed on a person's head or in which a person's body is briefly placed under water
A baptism officially makes someone a member of the Christian Church. [count]
There were over 100 baptisms at our church last year. [noncount]
He received the sacrament of baptism as an infant. - often used figuratively
The interview was a baptism into journalism for the young writer. [=it was the young writer's first experience as a journalist]
A baptism of fire or (chiefly US) baptism by fire is a first experience that is very difficult or painful, such as the first time that soldiers are in a battle.
He described his troop's baptism of fire on the front lines.
Covering the disaster was a baptism by fire for the young reporter.

Danh từ
(tôn giáo)
lễ rửa tội
a baptism of fire
lần ra trận đầu tiên(của người lính)
sự thử thách đầu tiên
a young teacher facing her baptism of fire
cô giáo trẻ đứng trước thử thách đầu tiên của mình
